title: Cannot install Flask on Ubuntu Server 14.10
body:
No matter what I try (setup.py Pip), I always get a maximum recursion depth exceeded. I know nothing about Python, and I need it as a requirement for another program. How could I go about fixing this?

comments_inline.body:
Try removing the offending line from Flask's setup.py.

I suppose you're installing this from the git repo?

Actually, I found he source at http://pypi.python.org/packages/source/F/Flask/Flask-0.10.1.tar.gz . However pip gives the same error:

```
File "/tmp/pip-build-p4Sb8e/Flask/setup.py", line 110, in <module>
   test_suite='flask.testsuite.suite'
```

And after removing a few 'offending lines', the recursive error just keeps moving up a few lines.

```
File "setup.py", line 92, in <module>
   platforms='any',
```

(Both with and without the comma in that line)

It just keeps calling recursion error, up until the entire setup function has been removed.

As for the github repository, it gives a different error:

```
File "setup.py", line 91, in <module>
   '''
```

When I remove that, I get another error:

```
File "setup.py", line 86, in <module>
   'Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules'
```
Are you even able to install any other program at all?

@Candunc Is your packaging infrastructure broken for other packages as well?

Closing this because it's almost certainly not an issue in Flask.
